title: AITA for telling my sister she looks for excuses to get upset?
body:
My sister is 30 years old and graduated with a Liberal Arts degree from a local university.

​

Today she sent me, my mom, and my dad a pdf of a letter from some of her old professors saying that they reject the "disinvitation" of a speaker to the graduating class of the English Lit/Social Science program. Her email only said "I'm so fed up of this shit. This is such bullshit. I wrote back to the professors giving them my support over this crap".

​

I replied with "Why are you so upset? How does this affect you? Do you even know who the speaker is? Or what they wrote about? It sounds like you want to be upset by something"

​

She wrote back that I was being an asshole and that she didn't "know anything about the guy, but my professor said he isn't sexist or homophobic". I did some research on my own and found a recent interview he gave where he said that women are obviously ill-suited to leadership or science-heavy roles and that gay men/lesbians are "shameful". 

​

So I replied, sent her the link to the interview and said "this is why people are upset. You got immediately emotionally invested and worked up, and even wrote back to your prof, with literally 0 knowledge on the subject. You didn't bother to even google the guy/issue and see what the controversy was, just formed an opinion because someone told you to".

​

She got really upset and demanded that I apologize to her for being aggressive and rude. I refused and said that I wasn't sorry for telling her to do her own research on a topic before getting upset and engage in some critical thought.

​

Now she and both my parents are upset saying that I went over the line, that I should apologize, and that I should reflect on how I speak to family.

​

I tried to be as comprehensive here, but let me know if you have any questions/need more info.

​

So, AITA?

EDIT: the full email transcript as requested

Her: I'm so fed up of this shit. This is such bullshit. I wrote back to the professors giving them my support over this crap

Me:Why are you so upset and fed up? Who cares? How does this affect you in any way?

Do you even know who this person is? Or what they wrote about? It sounds like you want to get upset by something

Her: You don't need to be such an asshole. Im upset because I come from the humanities and it makes me upset that people are silenced when their opinions are different.

I don't know anything about him, but from what my professor said, this man isn’t sexist and he disagrees with the decision to disinvite him.

And this does affect future generations. I don’t want the universities to become a place where people are silenced because their options are different.

Me: That's the entire point.

You got immediately emotionally invested and worked up, and even wrote back to the prof, with literally 0 knowledge on the subject. You didn't bother to even google the guy/issue and see what the controversy was, just formed an opinion because someone told you to.

Her: You don’t even know what I said to the professor [my name]. Anyway, clearly we can’t have discussions about this.

I don’t get why you need to be so aggressive about this. You owe me an apology, Im waiting

Me: lol I'm not sorry for telling you that you should actually put in a modicum of critical thought before getting outraged. Do your own research on a topic instead of just getting upset because someone told you to

title: WIBTA if I cut ties with a friend who is struggling with mental health issues?
body:
So this friend (I'll call her Jackie) is not someone I've ever actually gotten along with. In high school, my other friend (Martha) brought Jackie into our social group, kind of taking Jackie under her wing, because she didn't have any friends. During this time, Martha was the one who was really there for her, as no-one else in our group really bonded with her.

Fast forward 12 years, and Martha is studying for a masters in the other end of the country, and has basically assigned me as a babysitter for Jackie, asking me to check up on her, to ask how she is doing and so on. I meet up with Jackie once a week, despite it filling me with quite a bit of dread and anxiety, and we hang out. It often feels like an interrogation. She'll talk about everything negative in her life, ask me some questions about my life, and then try to poke holes in everything I say - whether it is what career I am pursuing, how I'm pursuing it, my casual options about books/tv/film or literally anything. Every interaction feels tense, like I am being grilled for any fodder to make Jackie feel worse about herself and her own life.

I do not hate Jackie or think she is a terrible person in any way, but she has some serious mental health issues that make it hard to have a relaxed relationship with her. Martha has tried to get her to seek help multiple times, but Jackie denies it and hasn't seeked any help. With my own background of mental health issues, I am very concerned for her and still have sympathy, and have stuck this relationship out more than some of my other friends, but at the same time I'm fulfilling all of Jackie's fears. She thinks everyone dislikes her. I do dislike her. She gets upset when I don't respond to her messages, I respond to her messages even less. I just know that she will spiral without some kind of human contact, and go to a very dark place mentally. Martha has already blown up at Jackie, telling her that she is done and can't deal with her any more. I really want to follow suit, but I know this will be really bad for her mental state, and she will have no one to support her anymore. WIBTA?

title: AITA For walking out on my prom date?
body:
So last week I had my senior prom at high school. I took a girl I was very close with and was very excited to go. She wasn't thrilled honestly, but got into it as the night went on. 


In the last hour of prom, she told me she was gonna go talk to her friends "for a few minutes." I said "ok" and thought nothing of it. I didn't see her for the rest of the night until the very end when we were all going home or to our after prom plans. She also refused to do the couple's dance with me. 


So I was sitting in the lobby waiting for my ride when she came over to me. She didn't seem to think anything was wrong with what she did, but I was livid. I'm telling you right now, I was so mad I could barely speak to her. I didn't explain why at the time. She then went to the bathroom for a bit, but when she did, I just left and didn't say goodbye. Solely because I was feeling so hurt and I just needed to go. 


We didn't talk for a day. Then I texted her saying I was sorry for leaving without saying goodbye. She asked why I did that and I explained I was hurt and mad at her. She gave a halfhearted (in my opinion) apology and that was it. After that, we haven't talked much. And she mostly ignored me at our graduation. We haven't talked in close to a week by now. 


So reddit, am I the asshole or what?

title: AITA For going fishing?
body:
This situation is the center of a two year long argument between my group of friends. I just found this sub and it will have the final say. 

Two years ago i was dating a girl called Amanda, we had been together for the better part of three months. She invited me to a banquet for her sorority where it would be announced that she won their presidential election. For the record I agreed to this banquet three weeks ahead of time. 

fast forward two weeks: on Monday (the banquet was that Friday) I got a call from my Dad, He was fishing in an annual ed fish tournament. Every year I hoped that I would get a call that they had an open spot on the team. This was that call, the catch was that I had to be in Houston (a five hour drive) by Thursday night, making me miss the banquet. I said yes to my Dad immediately as this was something that I had been aching to do for years. 

As soon as I got off the phone, I went to lunch with Amanda and broke the news. She was obviously upset which is something I do feel bad about. I do not however regret going, the argument is that this is something that Amanda should never forgive me for. Which she said she did. I don't think I did anything that bad because it was something I really really cared about. 

So Reddit am I an asshole for missing something important to her and doing something important to me?

TL;DR I missed her banquet to go fishing with my dad

title: AITA For Deciding To Reclaim What Was Going To Be My Brother's Christmas Present?
body:
Some context before I get into my AITA topic :  


My brother \[ 19 \] has Asperger's syndrome, and due to it taking a while to figure out his medications, I \[ 16f \] have mild PTSD from his outbursts when we were younger, and general loud noises \[ yelling, crashing sounds, ect \] freak me out, and I get incredibly defensive as a result. He's been made aware of this, but will raise his voice when he doesn't understand things. I try to avoid him most days now, but I see him every once in a blue moon at the dinner table.

\-

There was a Black Friday to Cyber Monday sale taking place on the site where I personally get my dice sets , and my brother loves TTRPGs but.. only has one single dice set, that's matte and pretty basic looking \[ plain blue acrylic with white inked numbers \]. I found a galaxy themed iridescent 11pc set on the site and almost immediately bought it knowing that he'd like it, getting it 3 days later, and using one of my own dice bags to hold the dice before putting them in the box to wrap and put under the tree. It was the first time I got my brother a present that wasn't just a game card, and I was super stoked!

At the dinner table last night I was explaining some drama I had to deal with online to my mom I used the term 'scapegoat' in reference to myself, as one of my 'friends' is, by definition, using me as a scapegoat- but that's for another time in another sub. My brother, determined that I was using the word incorrectly, butt in trying to explain to me something I already knew. I did cut him off near the end of his spiel and I tried to explain that I *was* using the word properly, and I was met with him *slamming* his fork prongs down on his plate and again started loudly trying to convince me that I was wrong.

I told him to put the fork down and stop acting high and mighty if he wanted me to care, to which he started yelling, and my mom tried to break up the situation- I don't remember what exactly was said here because at this point I was ready to just ditch dinner and go hungry, and I spaced out since I didn't want to deal with it. My mom tried to ask me for the context again, and I told her that there's no point, because I'm apparently some moron with a 3rd grade reading level that needs a dictionary for Christmas \[ I knew my brother hadn't gotten me a Christmas present yet, because he doesn't like the fact I have more dice than him, and doesn't know what to get me other than that- at least this is what my ma told me \], before I decided I was done for the night, and headed to my room.

  
I feel like we're both assholes in our own right in this situation, but I'd also like the internet's verdict

title: AITA for saying that the thought of having sex with another guy makes me uncomfortable? (Long)
body:
Okay, so this happened yesterday evening at my local pub. It was a public holiday here in the U.K. and a lot of people were out for the evening, more than usual on a Monday night. One of those was an old schoolfriend whom I haven't seen for a good 4 years. We'll call him James. We were never especially close, but got on pretty well. It was nice to see him and catch up, and since leaving school and going off to uni has come out openly as gay.

We were chatting about a variety of things, and he was talking about the gay scene at his uni and how he came to terms with his homosexuality and stuff, and it was really great to talk to him about relationships and stuff and most importantly to see how happy he was - in his last year at school he went through some personal issues, and while I'm not absolutely sure if it was anything to do with his sexuality, a lot of people even at the time suspected that was the case.

Both of us had had a few drinks, although he didn't seem openly drunk or anything. At one point he made a remark that it was a shame that I'm not gay because he gives really great head and thought I would enjoy it. I kind of laughed it off, it was fairly innocuous, plus I'd been talking to him about my girlfriend so he knew that I wasn't gay, though he may have wondered if I was bi. Evidently he was wondering, because he asked if I had ever considered experimenting with guys. My reply was that I had never given it any *serious* thought, mainly because the thought of actually being sexual with another guy makes me feel uncomfortable.

His response was, "Wow, that's pretty homophobic." To which I explained that, to my knowledge of the term, I'm not homophobic, merely that I myself would almost certainly find no enjoyment or pleasure from experimenting with a guy. After, I could tell he had gone a bit cold towards me, and after a minute or so he made his excuses and went to join his friends. About ten minutes later, a girl whom I've never met before - let's call her Katie - came over to me and started berating me in the middle of the pub for being, in her own words, "violently homophobic" towards James. After effectively being shouted at for a good five minutes by Katie, with me trying to get a word in edgeways to explain why I didn't feel I'd been homophobic, the landlord of the pub came over and said that if the shouting didn't stop we'd both be thrown out. In the end, I finished my drink and a friend and I went somewhere down the road to get away from the glowering stares we were getting.

This morning, I sent James a message via Facebook and apologised for any confusion or offence caused, but he saw it and hasn't replied. Normally something like this wouldn't get to me so much, but I consider myself to be a very open, inclusive and accepting person of all sexualities, genders, orientations and the like. Hell, I pride myself on it. I don't feel like what I said was wrong, but from both James and Katie's reactions it's obvious that they took offence.

Am I the asshole here?

**

title: AITA for telling my neighbor to call the cops instead of just threatening it?
body:
Okay, so my husband and I moved out of state recently. He moved before me and about two weeks after he moved, I came for a visit to bring the pets. In our new rental house, we don't have a driveway or parking, so we street park just like everyone else on this street. On the last day of my visit, my husband and I went out to eat and when we got back to the house, our neighbor came out of her house to inform us that we shouldn't be parking there (on the street in front of her house). She talked to us for about ten minutes about people parking there and having to get the cops involved and how she was mad about the way our rental was constructed, which has nothing to do with me or my husband. She finally stopped talking and we went inside with a funny story about our crazy neighbor.

That was about a month and a half ago, and now I'm living here. My husband started parking his car further down the street to avoid more interactions, but I recently purchased a car and there isn't room elsewhere to park, so I started parking there again. I'm not in the no parking zone, so I didn't see the problem. There's a clearly red-painted part of the curb, so I always make sure I'm not in the red, so to speak.

Today, our neighbor came pounding on our door to tell us that she's going to call the cops on us because of where we're parking, but she's trying to be a nice neighbor and "tell us how to live in this neighborhood because I've been here for 66 years, this is just the way it is." She also went on to say that she is unhappy that we have two dogs and she doesn't like where we put our trash bins. She continues to drone on with complaints and at one point says "I could just call the cops, but I'm trying to be nice." I got mad and said "So call them." To which she responded to my husband, "And watch that, her mouth is going to get her into trouble one day." Eventually we got her to leave.

After she left, my husband was kind of upset with me for how I responded, but I felt it was incredibly disrespectful of her to speak to us like that in our house. This is not someone who has earned my respected, so she doesn't deserve it. I'm not trying to cause problems, but I'm a firm believer in standing up for myself. So, am I the asshole?

tldr: My neighbor kept threatening to call the cops on me because of my street parking despite the fact that it's legal. I told her to do it. AITA?

title: AITA for selling a couch to a different customer?
body:
I'm on mobile so formatting may be off. 

I work at a furniture store and my coworker had a customer in that was looking at a couch. They decided to go home and measure to make sure it fits. A few hours passed and another customer came in. I started showing them around the store and they fell in love with the same couch that I mentioned earlier. This couch is an unicorn. Manufacturer doesn't make it any longer and it's the last one in stock. They start trying to haggle to bring the price down a little bit. I tell them I have to talk to a manager so I excuse myself and go to the front office. 
At the same time, my co-worker's customer comes in and pulls me aside and tells me that they're ready to purchase the couch. They said that if they knew someone else was looking at it, they would have paid full price. They also said that since they were there first, they should have gotten it since technically my coworkers customer came in after them. I apologized but I think I did the right thing.

So, AITA?

title: AITA for getting mad at my friend when she has to deal with racial prejudice?
body:
I have a female friend of Indian heritage who often posts online about the prejudice she has to deal with on a daily basis, usually in an angry way. Most of the time these are understandable, but sometimes it feels like she takes things a bit too far. One day she posted an angry mocking post about how a movie I love, The Breakfast Club, should be severely discredited because the biggest problems the characters faced were being “white as shit”. This was at a time when I was being made fun of by other people for dating a cis white guy when I am bisexual, and something in me snapped. 

I wrote a retort about how diversity awareness and inclusion is an important factor that the media needs to work on, but that her post undermined the very purpose of the movie (to look past prejudice and find common ground with those different than you). I then went on to say that her post harmed the racial awareness movements more than it helped it, because it’s attacking the people she’s asking awareness from by belittling their entire life experience to being “white as shit”. 

She wrote a long response in which she accused me of suffering from white guilt, stated my biggest motivation is getting other people to like me, and told me I wasn’t being an ally. She got quite personal, diagnosing my mental health, then visited my facebook profile and upon seeing nothing (I delete my posts every ten days) came back and accused me of blocking her. 

We then tried to talk in private message, but it was very tense and our conversation got nowhere, and eventually she deleted the post and unfriended me. We haven’t talked since. 

A couple of my friends saw the exchange and told me that she went too far but that I wasn’t being an ally and that I don’t have to go what she goes through, and for the future even if I feel I’m being attacked I need to remember that I don’t have to suffer racial prejudice and it’s better to take it in stride and remember my privilege. I want to be a good ally… but it hurts to be belittled.

title: AITA for asking people at my birthday meet to give me presents?
body:

title: AITA for getting kicked out?
body:
Back in august of 2017 I was living with my dad, he is in his in his 60's and I am 18. Well, one day my dad was at the kitchen table drinking coffee with his friends, when he saw my cat messing around with one of his plants. He called me into the room to make me make the cat stop, so I picked him up and took him to my room. Well, a few hours later, i'm getting ready for work and the cat does it again so my dad yells at me and tells me "get that thing under control or i'll take it outside and shoot the fucking thing." I put the cat back into my room, closed the door and told my dad "Fuck off you psycho" and went to work. I come home after work and my birth certificate, Social Security Card and other paperwork are on my computer desk. He comes into my room and says "i'm fucking off. get out of my house." and goes outside and takes the license plates off my car (which is my only way to work, i was a pizza delivery boy. But he also bought them and paid the insurance, so he had the right to do it i guess) and tells me to leave. I pack up some things and i lived with my girlfriend for a few months before working at mcdonalds for a while and getting enough to have an apartment.

It's been all this time since and he recently ripped a hernia he had and is telling me its my fault because I made him lonely and sad by "being a disrespectful punk" and he's saying he's "gonna die with my kid hating me." I told him i wasn't going to apologize to him unless I get an apology and he refuses. He just keeps saying i'm a bad person for really leaving and all that.

I just feel so guilty, am I the asshole here? should I have just not said anything and stayed home? this changed my whole life and I feel guilty every night over it.

title: AITA if I don’t watch my family’s dog?
body:
My family (mom, dad, sister) are going on an international trip for roughly three weeks in June. Originally my husband and I were going to dogsit their husky at our house because they don’t really have anyone else to watch her, and definitely no one else to take her in for that long.

About two weeks ago, I decided to cut contact with my mom and sister, with low contact with my dad because for most of my teenage and adult life (I’m 28), they expect me to bend over backwards to do whatever they want for them while completely disregarding how I feel. If something is bothering them, it’s an end-of-the-world issue, and if literally the same thing is bothering me, “who cares it’s no big deal”. My whole beef with them is they come to me when they need me to do something to help, and promptly ignore me afterwards. I’ve had enough and I don’t want anything to do with them while this is the current status quo. 

That aside, I really love their dog. I took care of her from when she was a puppy until she was 4 when I no longer lived at their house. Unfortunately, knowing my mom, she’s not willing to spend hundreds of dollars boarding her when they leave for vacation and will most likely ask other family members to check in on her twice a day to feed/water her... which means she’s going to be left at home alone for three weeks. It’s really inconvenient for us to take care of her since she’s not housetrained (parents wouldn’t let her in the house) and we don’t have a separate gated area in our yard to keep her when we need to leave for work/errands and someone has to hold her while we move the car. She doesn’t get along with one of our dogs (loves the other) and will constantly attack her, and they need to be separated at all times. 

My dilemma is if I say yes, I’m only perpetuating how my family treats me where they can ignore me or not care about me until they need me. I’m pretty sure my dad had to fake a conversation so he could ask again if I’m watching her. It’s only been a week and they either think nothing is wrong, or they can continue asking me for help through my dad since I blocked everyone else. 

I feel like saying no would be selfish because ultimately, the dog is the one who will pay and she doesn’t deserve that. So... given my situation, AITA if I say no? Should I suck it up and do it this one last time?

title: AITA for telling my babymomma I thought she might be Autistic?
body:
Me and the my BM have been seperated practically since conception. She has Bipolar Disorder, Major Depression, ADHD and Anxiety, and her behavior was always alarming to me. Not in a way I believed would ever harm my child, but in a way that would make everything incredibly difficult for me to be as involved as I wanted (Denying me paternity acknowledgment, calling SS on me for no reason, denying me visitation, etc.) She never seemed able to step in my shoes, sometimes it was very hard to "connect" with her, and her emotions in general seemed vastly different than most. Sometimes her tone wouldn't match her emotion, she would tell story's in a very disconnected and impersonal way, and she just couldn't take any level of criticism and didn't seem to be able to analyze her own behavior. 

I kept this all to myself, until my mother picked up my son from daycare and they pulled her to the side to ask if we understood Victoria's behavior. They were describing a lot of the same things we experienced, and my mother told the lady at the daycare that she thinks Victoria may have autism, which also seemed to make sense to them. I've also had a few friends think this too, though admittedly they didn't know her personally, just through me telling stories. 

At some point we started trying to be friends again. I'm very weird in the sense that I struggle with being acquaintances or "kind of" friends, im either on a deep thing all the time or I just don't me as with you much. Anyway, I was trying to tell her a few things I was experiencing from her from my perspective, and at some point the conversation came up that I didn't believe she did anything mean out of ill intent, but her behavior may have been off due to her mental illnesses. She's a naturally sweet and incredibly caring, I don't believe she was trying to do anything except try to feel like her and her child were safe no matter how erratic she was. I forget exactly how the conversation went, but I told her I thought she may be autistic and a few others believed this as a possibility as well. She exclaimed she knew she was not, than asked who else thought this. I told her the situation with the daycare, and of the friends who came to this conclusion as well. She seemed hurt... Her friend texted me later saying my ego was getting in the way of my reality and I was being cruel and belittling her. I felt as though I was attempting to get her to understand my perspective, as well as other peoples perspective, so she could know that people experience a disconnect with her she may not be aware of and so she could address the issue with a professional. As a matter of fact, she did, and two separate psychologist told her she indeed was not autistic. I still am not sure if her "disconnect" comes from Bipolar, Anxiety, or (not trying to be rude) a low IQ, but I'm not the only one who experiences this with her.

What do you think? Am I an asshole?

title: WIBTA if i moved out of my mom's house without catching up on taxes?
body:
So my mom "gave" me this house after she moved away to another state while I was pregnant with my daughter. My fiance and I have started fixing up the house by doing MAJOR repairs. The house had leaks that she neglected for years and we ended up having to gut the bathroom and kitchen and it still needs a lot more work. We had to replace rotted sub-flooring, walls, and support beams. The kitchen needed the same and we threw away all of the cabinets that were rotted from water damage and roaches. We completed removed all of the carpet that her dogs peed in over and over. The house still needs a lot of more work. We have put in about $5k into the house.

She moved back to the state when I had the baby and rents a house from her in laws. But, she comes over whenever she wants, she stays for however long she wants, and most of the time the biggest heads up is that she is OTW.

She has become an alcoholic and I don't want her drinking at my house. To make a long story short, she was drinking around my daughter and after she would leave to go back to her house I would find bottles from her and her BF drinking in the spare room. She agreed to not drinking then started to do it behind my back. Now she's playing the victim saying I wont let her around her Granddaughter.

My fiance and I got approved for a house loan and are looking for a house. WIBTA for leaving her to pay the back taxes?

Info requested: Taxes are about $1600. She has not signed over the house to me and is now saying the house is hers and "How dare her for kicking me out of my own house." One of the reasons I am getting my own house.

Edit: So from what I’m seeing I’m NTA because my mom didn’t officially sign it over to me and I was basically living rent free. I never pressed for the deed because I didn’t think my mom would do a dick move and claim that the house was hers. But that’s my mistake. My family (brothers and sister) feels like I should still pay the taxes though? I’m more financially stable than her but I don’t think that matters. I haven’t told my mom of my plans to move out yet. I didn’t know when to tell her...

title: AITA for cursing at my dad after he walked into my bathroom while I was showering?
body:
Hi, for context, we have a really strained relationship already.  He was abusive when I was in high school, which got better after I got into my university of choice and eventually moved.  I have always preferred my mom, despite her not leaving him during the abuse, and he definitely knows this.

I am now 19 (F) and have repeatedly (ever since high school) told him that because I have a shower with a clear, glass divider instead of a curtain that I do not want him inside of my bathroom while I am taking a shower.  It just makes me uncomfortable because I’m a fully grown, developed person and not a child.  He always shrugs this off and says he saw me naked as a baby so it doesn’t matter.  

Today, he came into my bathroom without knocking to ask a question and after I answered, trying to get him out as soon as possible, he started peeing into my toilet.  I began screaming at him “What the fuck are you doing, get out” and after he continued to stay I screamed “get out get out GET OUT!!!”. 30 minutes later, when he and my siblings came into my room unannounced, they left the door open and I said “at least close the door if you’re not going to knock you inconsiderate pos” which I know is over the line and inappropriate, but honestly, I was pissed and I don’t know if that makes me an asshole.

My dad then began to yell at me, screaming “Fuck you, bitch” and bringing up my insecurities saying I was being overdramatic and thats why I have no decent friends (which is not true but just is a shitty thing to say).

Also because I have to say this, this isn’t fake.  I’m actually having a mental breakdown about if i’m overdramatic and a narcissist and don’t know it, I don’t know if this is just normal parent stuff or if it’s okay for me to be upset about this.

TL;DR: Im a 19 year old girl who has a shower you can see everything in if you come into my bathroom.  I’ve told my dad to not come in multiple times, he didn’t listen and today came in and peed while I was showering.  I cursed at him to get out and cursed at him later in the day.  AITA??

edit: to clarify, I didn’t intentionally direct my yelling at my siblings.  in fact, they’re really the only reason i haven’t completely cut contact from my family.  I’m out of the house for 80% of the year and live across the country for uni and my job.  thanks for telling me i’m not crazy, i felt like i was spinning out of control

title: AITA for saying we can’t get a cat from a Breeder
body:
My husband’s childhood cat—a sphinx(hairless cat) passed away a few years ago and we’ve talked about getting one ourselves(that one lived with his mom).


I told him the only way we are getting one is if we find one at the shelter or go through a rescue. I 100% do not support buying cats from Breeders and he knows this.


He thinks I’m being mean and unfair because if we go through a rescue, the cat will most likely be old, disabled, or sickly.  We’ve been in contact with all the local shelters to see if there are ever any, but there aren’t. 


His “solution” is to get 2 cats, one Sphinx from the Breeder and one shelter cat. 


I am still putting my foot down.


Edit: since so many are saying I shouldn’t be able to “put my foot down”. We BOTH have feet in the game here. We are married. This is OUR home. We would never bring an animal in to this house that we don’t both agree on. That goes for both parties. If I wanted a dog but he absolutely didn’t, I wouldn’t go behind his back and bring one in anyway.

title: AITA for Wanting to Keep the Dog?
body:
A month ago my fiancée told me she didn't want to get married anymore.  We had been together for 3 years and engaged for 5 months with the wedding planned for August.  Of course I was devasted but we ended on good terms and later after talking through her thoughts on things I saw her point.  We always supported and loved each other but our interests and passions couldn't be more different.  We'll both be happier in the long run this way.

Now for the AITA question, who should keep the dog?  She's moving back in with her parents who are retired, who will be home all day, so even while she's at work he'll have company.  They have a big backyard in the suburbs and have had dogs before and know how to care for them.  I live in the city in a ground floor condo with a small back and front patio, but have two large off leash dog parks nearby.  Both of us work, but I generally have longer hours than her, so I am gone from 7:30-5.

She's saying having a dog is too much work for one person and he could instead be home all day with people.  She's also saying I'm putting my own interests above what's best for him (hence the asshole). My plan is to walk him for an hour in the morning at the dog park, have a dog walk walker come in at lunch and then take him to the dog park after work again.  I'm fully willing to make this commitment for his whole life. I also love the outdoors and camping, and would be taking him with me all the time on weekends.  He loves the woods and camping, but that's something she has no interest in, so he wouldnt have any experiences like that anymore.

We're sharing custody right now until we figure it out but that's not a solution we want long term.  AITA for wanting to keep the dog even though he could be living in a house with a big backyard?

title: WIBTA if I told my friend’s fiancé that she’s cheated on him?
body:
A-friend
B-her fiancé 

A and I grew up together. She comes from a broken home and all through high school and the first few years of college had relationship after relationship with whom she thought was “the one” until they weren’t and she moved onto a new guy who was “the one.” Basically, she has been on the hunt for a husband since we were eleven.

A couple years ago A met B through a work thing and they hit it off. B is significantly older than A. Their relationship progressed fast, A moved into his apartment after a month of dating. Because A and I are close friends she tells me a lot and I know that for the first six months of their relationship they were fucking like rabbits. That is, until B became super religious and told A that he wanted to wait until marriage to have sex again.

Understandably, this was a big problem for A. Ever since B made that decision there has been an almost unending stream of fights and tension. A and I live twelve hours away from each other so I don’t know B super well and really only know him through what A tells me (the times that I have met him, he seems like a sweet guy.) I have told her many times that their values don’t line up, and as B is getting more and more religious they are disagreeing on more and more big things.

Over the summer B proposes to A. A is over the moon excited, because getting married is something that she’s always wanted and starts thinking that now since they’re engaged that they can start having a physical relationship again. Nope, and B wants to put off the wedding. A tells me that since they got engaged that B has become even more distant physically.

A still refuses to breakup with B. 

A few months pass after their engagement and A calls me to tell me that while B was on a business trip she slept with a friend multiple times. A tells me that she doesn’t even really feel guilty because B had made it clear to her that he will not be intimate with her until they are married, basically trying to convince me (and herself) that she had no other option. 

A few more months pass and here we are, A and B are still engaged, still fighting and still appear completely wrong for each other, but neither will bite the bullet and break up. 

If I was B I would want to know that my fiancé is cheating on me, but if I tell him (even anonymously) it will destroy A and I’s friendship because I’m pretty sure that I’m the only person who knows besides A and her friend. I would feel so horrible if they went through with the wedding, because I think their problems extend a lot further than A just not getting any action. I don’t even know if B would break up with her if he knew but I just can’t imagine starting a life together with a huge lie like that. So, WIBTA if I told my friend’s fiancé that she’s been cheating on him?

title: AITA for having an option to help fund our honeymoon in our wedding registry?
body:
This is lighter fare than a lot of what gets posted here, but I'm honestly still thrown for a loop and I'd love some third-party input.

My wife and I had a pretty middle-of-the-road wedding in terms of costs; it was definitely nice, but not a blowout or anything. My parents covered almost everything, as was their plan from the start. During the RSVP/invite window, my mom jokingly gave me shit for not putting up a registry yet-- we had honestly forgotten about it, because we weren't really in need of any gifts and didn't expect anyone to do so. She said people would probably feel awkward if they didn't get us *anything,* especially since she and my dad were covering every cost (including lodging), so my wife and I sat down to discuss it. We agreed we'd make an Amazon wishlist for some household stuff that we didn't have and kind of wanted, but that didn't end up amounting to much-- but what we *did* actually want was a little more wiggle room on our honeymoon. I want to be clear here: the trip was paid for already, from our own money, but it was that we had cut a lot of corners to fit it into our budget that gave us the idea for the fund. It made enough sense to us; instead of giving us things we don't need, if you feel compelled, you can donate a comparable dollar amount to this account that will be spent on padding out our dream trip as a couple.

We went through with it and added the option to our RSVP/general wedding info site. Again, to be clear here: there was *no* expectation of gifts in the first place, monetary or otherwise, which we even said on the site. Simply that if someone did feel the need to give us a gift, and nothing on the wishlist sounded good, this was another thing they could do.

The wedding came and went and it was genuinely beautiful, everyone had a wonderful time and I couldn't have asked for things to go any better. No one had said anything about the fund or the registry at all; a few things had been purchased from the wishlist and a few donations had been made (all of which we were deeply grateful for and were prepared to write the *shit* out of some thank you cards), but it wasn't a topic of conversation.

A few days later, though, we were shooting the shit with some extended family that had stayed on, and one of my aunts kind of blew up over the honeymoon fund. Ranting about how "incredibly tacky" it was and how embarrassed we should feel over even having it there, much less expecting anyone to donate. We were kind of blindsided already, and then a few cousins agreed that it was weird and kind of snobby of us, and that we should have just been "normal" and stuck to a physical registry even if we didn't need or want that stuff.

This isn't tearing our family apart and it's not that big a deal, but I'm really struggling to wrap my brain around it. Was I really the asshole for giving an option to pay into a fund to pad out our honeymoon, despite being fully clear that no one was required or even expected to donate?

WIBTA if I told a friend he stinks?
body:
I’ve been attending a con this weekend and staying with some friends at a hotel. One friend that I’ll call Jack is one of the nicest people I’ve met. I’m not super close to him but Jack is known in his circle of friends to be one of the most loyal and generous people. 

This is my first time at the con and before it started, Jack said one of the rules is to shower “at least once a day”. And I’m thinking this is common sense (yeah I know this common sense is hard for a lot of con goers), and I honestly think he does shower every day because when he leaves the hotel room in the morning his hair is wet. 

But man, Jack stinks. I don’t know how else I’d describe it other than he emits a nightmare cocktail of scents. I’m not sure some of these scents have been discovered yet. This funk can be detected whenever he’s around and it’s unbearable. 

I’m not sure there’s a nice way to tell him. I’m not sure if it’s my place (like I said, not super close to him). I’m a pretty nice guy in person so I would try to go out of my way to do it in the nicest way possible, but yeah, would I be the asshole if I told Jack he smells?

title: AITA For Telling My Husband I Didn't Like His Vows?
body:
So got married a year ago. I had my vows written months before the wedding. Of course my husband (who I had been dating for 10 years) waited till a week before and had his brother look it over. (His brother is historically terrible at giving advice). 

Let me just say that big moments are not my husband's thing. The first time he said "I love you" was over Facebook. He tried to rush our marriage proposal and there was a hired photographer in my face the whole time. Whom I thought was a very rude bystandard at the time. So I guess this proposal was so very much fitting of my husband. I'm pretty sure he gets it from his dad. (Who one family Christmas party got drunk and told his entire family how he used to bang his now wife who is basically the mother Mary of Catholics)

So big day and half a year of me and my mom planning. Had over 200 people mostly his ginormous and awesome family and children there (this is important). His family is way bigger than mine. And it has taken me years to get over my anxiety around them.

Everything is great except I can barely breathe because my seamstress made my dress to tight. (Went fuzzy when I first put it on) I say my vows which were really straight to the point but from the heart.

Husband starts off okay talking about how we met. Okay no biggie pretty normal. (Warning rated PG13) Then gets into his favorite stories **one of which** is how he one day came home work and saw me posing naked taking pictures of myself. (I am a hobby artist, so I use pictures of myself to get a pose and light right. Note that I have never shown my family my art and have told my husband I am extremely uncomfortable about the idea of it).

Needless to say I was mortified. My grandparents and parents were, of course, there along with about 20 children. I had decided that I would let absolutely **nothing** ruin my day that day so I just got past it and went to the next thing. The end of his vows were actually perfect and from the heart. The rest of the wedding went off without a hitch we both had a great time and I get lots of good comments to this day. 



But I have said a few times how I would have preferred he had kept that out if the vows. I've told him how I wish he had just stuck to the end of his vows which I loved
 
AITA

Tldr; my husband "undressed me" during his vows.

Edit: he has said he feels bad and I don't bring it up we were watching a movie yesterday that had a vow scene and he brought it up. But when he says he feels bad I say something like "yea it woulda been nice if you left that out". I'm afraid I'm hurting his feelings when I say this. Should I lie and say it doesn't bother me?

title: AITA for not wanting to be friends with my friend who recently started dating her friend's ex?
body:
Everyone mentioned in this post is in their early 20s.

I have this friend from college, let's call her J. J and I are really close friends and she is one of the sweetest people I know (or so I thought?). She is a year older than me. I've never had any problems with J and our friendship has been really great for the most part, she's very supportive, funny and caring.

She has a best friend T that is her age. I don't really know T, I just know that J has had some issues with T before in the past with T being manipulative and such. T had a boyfriend S all through college that J was also close friends with. From what J told me, it sounded like T cheated on him multiple times or whatever. Anyways, T and S broke up last year in October or November 2018 or somewhere around that time period.

J and S still remained best friends after this, and they have recently been hanging out a lot more. J recently confessed to me that she and S have been hooking up recently and been talking about dating/becoming official. I straight up asked her if T knew about this, and she said yes that she had talked to T before anything had even started with S, and T was 100% ok with it but then T had went back on her word and tried to make her feel bad about it after things started. She told me that she and T fell out weeks afterward and J just told me that her friendship with T is complicated and that she doesn't want to get into it.

I told J I'm a bit uncomfortable knowing she'd consider dating a friend's ex and wondered if she would do the same to me if I ever dated a guy in the future and he and I broke up. She said she understood my concern and would understand if I didn't want to be friends anymore. She told me that she only got together with S because she had met T and S at the same time and became close to both of them through college, and that she wouldn't go out of her way to date someone she didn't already know, and that she didn't even plan this with S. She told me she gets it regardless and she's not going to force me to stay friends with her.

I've been discussing this with friends and some understand and think it's weird that J would do that to a friend but some others side with J saying that she and the guy were already friends and that she should be allowed to explore things with whoever she wants. AITA for not thinking it's a good thing and not wanting to be friends with someone like that?

title: AITA - For assuming a customers baby was a little girl based on their appearance?
body:
A little backstory. I work for a grocery store chain as a cashier at a very “touristy” part of the state I live in...and part of our job is interacting with the customer and having a brief conversation. Roughly 85% of the customers I won’t see again or at least not until the following summer. 

So yesterday I had a customer come into my line and she had a baby.... Her baby had big blue eyes, LONG blonde curls and was dressed in a yellow collar shirt, tan shorts, sandals! Her baby looked really did look like a little girl and stupid me says “Your little girl is so beautiful!” And the second those words left my mouth I knew I was going to regret it. Literally you could see the internal explosion this women was having. She starts slamming her produce on to the belt and in a very sharp tone goes “My Baby is a BOY!” followed by a stare that only could equal to a 1,000 daggers! So I immediately try to apologize and she holds her hand up as an indication of silence. “Save it you don’t mean it!” so now I’m standing there like WTF, my bagger is like WTF and thankfully the customer behind her had heard almost if not all of the entire situation and they chime in and say what I’m thinking “If you want people to know he’s a boy then cut his hair and stop dressing him gender neutral outfits! “ and this is where I wanted to dive over my register and pledge my undying allegiance to them because they didn’t give the angry customer time to respond they kept going “kinda like when you watch the weather and it says rain and you look outside and it’s raining. And so you decide to go out not dressed for rain, don’t bring an umbrella and you get mad cause you’re soaked! Play stupid games, win stupid prizes.” there was nothing but silence for the next 71 seconds!

Needless to say it took all I had to keep it together, the angry woman said nothing, paid for her groceries and left. I feel bad for her kid. I’m not trying to judge her for how she’s choosing to raise her child. But come on now...based on her reaction I think it’s safe to assume this is not the first time this has happened to her. So AITAH?

title: AITA for not liking my brother and sister-in-law taking my nephew everywhere when he is sick?
body:
I have a 2.5 year old nephew.  We live out of state from him and go into town to see relatives maybe 5-6 times a year.  Sometimes more often.  Every single time we have been into town for the past year and a half, nephew is sick.  Every time we come home sick for a good few weeks by the time it circles through everyone.  

I was talking to my mom earlier on the phone and she asked how my daughter is.  My daughter is three and is now on antibiotics fighting off what my nephew had.  My husband is sick and had to miss a few days of work.  I’m getting sick now.  We had been in town a week and a half ago for a baby shower.  My brother and sister-in-law brought nephew with this horrible cough and nose dripping.  The party was attended by one sicker elderly relative, kids, and several pregnant women.  

I commented to my mom, it’s hard coming to town anymore because we always get sick from nephew.  She started getting angry saying it sounds like I don’t like nephew anymore and he is just a child.  I said that it has nothing to do with him, it’s brother and sister-in-law bringing him sick to stuff.  I get they hate to miss the party, but either get a sitter or have one of them stay home.  Nephew was miserable anyways and now everyone is sick.  

But mom got all mad saying I was unreasonable and attacking a child by saying this.  She was angry and hung up in a hurry to go call my brother about what I said.

title: AITA For being disappointed that a more-than-friends friend of mine had her partner at a party we were both at?
body:
For the last couple months, I've been talking with and been close to this girl I met named Anna. She is the first person who I've had any feelings for in literally years.

Thing is, she's poly. Because of this and other reasons, we decided to not date. But we still about doing "stuff". We were planning on seeing each other this weekend, so I'm very excited. We live about three hours apart from each other, so we don't see each other frequently. She was having a party, mostly because her roommate wanted it, and she wasn't excited about the party. But I figure that she and I will have a good time like we normally do.

I've been looking forward to this because I was expecting it would be me and maybe one or two of her other friends there, with most everyone else being her roommates friends. Thing is, I found out two days ago that one of her partners (one of two) would be there. So I'm a bit disappointed because I was looking forward to spending time with her, but it is what it is. He's in the military. I knew he'd be around in July, but I didn't think he'd be back yet. I wasn't broken up. I get it. I went, drank, and had a good time.

At the end of the night, I was talking with her roommate (who uses they/them pronouns), and I mentioned my disappointment that her partner was there because I had been looking forward to spending time with just her. It was dumb and off-handed. But he and I got along well. I wasn't upset. We had a good time. It's just that my expectations were dashed.

I also talked about my relationship with her. She's close friends with her roommate, so I assumed that they knew about us. But the roommate didn't. I know the roommate, and I generally considered them a friend though not a close one. I'm surprised. I got out to smoke a cigarette, and I start hearing them saying "oh hell no," and "this isn't happening" from their window. I tell them that I hear what they're saying to their fiance and because I want to respect their privacy, I ask them to shut their window. They do. I go to bed. Whatever.

I get up in the morning, and me, Anna, and her partner all hang out for a bit before Anna goes to work. About 30 minutes after she's left, I get a call from her where she's in tears and furious. She's angry at me because the roommate claimed that I was mad that her partner was there.All I can say is "What?" I try to tell her that I wasn't mad, but she had to go into work. Before she hung up, she said that she doesn't want to talk to me, and that I shouldn't contact her for a long time. So I'm just freaked out. I send her a text explaining my side and that I wasn't angry. Now, maybe the roommate was drunk and didn't remember it correctly. Or maybe they're lying because they have their own motives. But either way, the damage seems done.

So, Am I the Asshole for being disappointed?

title: AITA For Not Buying Tickets
body:
Hello everyone.

So every year I love to attend a fun film festival called Fantastic Fest, it's down in Austin TX and is a weeks worth of cool and eccentric movies. I buy my wife and myself tickets every year. We know a couple who's expressed interest various times in the past. Although I should add that it's never a full commitment. It's always "Oh that would be fun send me more details" or "I'd be interested in that".

So I was buying our tickets and thought I'd reach out to them, so in a group chat I ask if they want to commit to buying tickets. They don't reply in the group chat. So I buy us two tickets and wipe my hands clean.

Now they're asking what we're doing about flights and accommodations. Had to break it to them that I didn't get them the tickets as they never got back to me. They're saying they did commit but looking over the messages it's never anything more than vague interest.

They're furious at me as I was buying the tickets, saying how I'm TA for not getting them tickets but I feel like I did everything I could've and that they should be responsible for themselves to a large degree. What do you think redditors?

title: AITA for wanting my partner to put her pay in our joint account?
body:
So, me and my partner have been together for 10 years. We have two children together, and we have always had shared finances with a shared bank account. This is because I have been the breadwinner up until this year while she has stayed home with the kids. 

We have had lots of arguments over money, she thinks I'm too controlling because I like to budget and don't want anything spent unless it has been budgeted. (Too often mid month she would bring up some expense that she failed to mention until the last minute, leaving me having to adjust the budget, which frustrated me.)
We were using budgeting software, and once or twice a month we would sit down and try and budget together. This would usually end in an argument about me trying to control where the money went, even though I was trying my hardest to get input from her. A typical comment would be "why are you asking me, you'll just do what you want anyway".

Skip to now, and because our youngest has started at daycare, she has been able to get part-time work. She has set up her own account and is keeping her money there where I can't see it, and doesn't think it's reasonable for me to want it in the joint account. My thinking is that with this extra income in the monthly budget, we can pay off our debts faster, or save up for a holiday etc but we should make the decision together. She wants to save it herself in a separate account so she can see the fruits of her labor (my wording). She says she won't be selfish with it but needs it to feel better about working and missing out on seeing the kids etc. 

Anyway I don't really know how other couples with families combine or separate their finances, so thought I'd see what Reddit thinks.

title: WIBTA if I drank "too much" milk at work?
body:
So I've got into the habit of going to the gym 2-4 times a week in the morning before work. To stave off getting really hungry at the gym, I'll have a meal replacement drink while I work out and I normally have my protein shake after as well.
Problem is that means having 2 bottles at the gym with me and having to drink them both within 1.5 hours (I add milk to my protein shake to increase my calorie/protein intake) and I end up feeling really gross and full.
I've got a new bottle that has a container cup that screws to the bottom that I can put the protein powder in and mix with milk and water later. My office has tea and coffee facilities where theres a few bottles of milk all the time but I'm worried that taking 200-300ml of milk almost every day would be taking the piss a bit!
Should I stop myself from taking milk at work or stop worrying about it and help myself to free stuff? WIBTA?

Edit: lots of recommendations to, rather obviously in hindsight, just buy my own milk. Thanks Reddit!

title: AITA For Getting Pissed and Reporting My Neighbors?
body:
What's up fellow assholes and judgemental people.

So, I have a feeling I'm the asshole in this case and I'll gladly accept whatever judgement is placed upon me by the Reddit Gods.

Since the beginning of the school year, the girls who lives next door has been awful. The dog one of them brought with was constantly barking/whimpering/crying, and I expressed worry to my parents as well as the RA. I get puppies get scared, but the extent was alarming. I only brought it up once.

Girl with the puppy moves about two months later. Girl remaining, I don't know what the hell her problem is, started to slam her door hard enough the walls/floor shakes. So, I left, slamming my door just as hard and storm out. And I called the campus police with a noise complaint.

AITA?

title: AITA for arguing with my dad because he gave some of my things away?
body:
He gave my old bicycle (which needed some repairs) and some good functional speakers to some poor kid without even asking me, like I got mad. Those things were bought with his and my mom's money, but they were gifted to me. He could've just gave him some money and leave my stuff where it was.

I went off on him for this, because he didn't even bother to ask me and we kept on arguing, he told me I'm being ungrateful and stuff, but it's not about that. He just keeps giving away stuff that isn't his. I don't care if he gives his car or his house for free, it's not mine anyways, but don't go and give my stuff away because you want to.

Another thing is that I got a job, but I barely get by anyways and I can't afford new stuff, so I gotta manage with what I got, but what to manage if he gives everything away because he wants to seem like a nice person and all, but be nice with your own stuff.

Probably I'm also selfish, but when it's like this, I don't care. I'm not rich and I work hard for what I've got.

title: AITA For Not speaking to my husband’s stepdaughter for over a year because she spewed racist comments at a family gathering in my home.
body:
Here’s the background. I’ve been With my husband for 20 years.My husband has a daughter from a previous relationship and she has a sister that’s not his but we still helped raise her and would always get her when we got his daughter because we didn’t want her left out. She had no father. I always treated them equally and always put in 110% to make sure everybody felt special. She’s 25 now and has a boyfriend definitely cheated on her that’s confirmed. No one in any of the families can stand him. She also has a 5 year old daughter and we’re all very nervous for him being around her daughter but she doesn’t care. He has flat out said I want to be with you but I don’t want to deal with your daughter. This has been confirmed. She’s also come crying to me about him several times about him cheating,and I’ve dropped everything to be there for her and listen to her and give her advice. She comes to my House for a family gathering with company and family from out of town. She’s Hispanic as is my husband and our company is Hispanic and native. I am white. If it matters. She’s selling a product and brought it with her to show people it came with a brochure where she had to write a brief paragraph about herself. In the paragraph it said she was engaged. I had not heard about this And I asked to who? Confused because surely it’s not this guy. She just nods her head yes I try to be nice and ask OK so you’re in planning wedding mode and she makes a comment in front of everybody about how they wanna do a Destination wedding to Germany but there’s too many immigrants there. then made derogatory claims about Muslim people. I guarantee she’s never even met a Muslim person. Now I’m hypersensitive to racism I won’t tolerate it.I never have. I grew up in an inclusive house my parents encourage learning other cultures it’s ingrained in me and is part of my core value and I don’t waver on it. Three of us immediately started questioning what she was saying we were shocked and embarrassed. She then starts screaming that she’s a conservative and grabs her daughter and storms out of the house. This was over a year ago. I have not reached out to her for the entire year because why should I. She came in to my home was spewing her hate snatched up her daughter and left. Now the whole dynamics of the family has changed. She’s never apologize for the scene she made in my home. Everybody in my family took my side and had my back. They still do. I feel bad for her daughter my step granddaughter whatever you wanna call her. My husbands daughter has also confronted her on her racial issues and they have gone weeks without speaking because of it.  No no one knows how to handle family gatherings. I don’t wanna be around her it’s super uncomfortable and awkward now. But life has also been much calmer without her in it and her drama. 
Should I have done something different?

title: AITA for snapping at my brother after he kept telling me how to drive ?
body:
For further information, I'm talking about my twin brother so we both passed our driving test at the same time. For a few months he drove more than I did, simply because it made me nervous. It feels like he thinks I don't know how to drive - simply because I'm not as overconfident as he is (he had 4 small accidents in a bit more than a year vs me having made a bump in the back of the car while parking).

At that point it really annoyed me and told him why I thought I was right. I have to say that I might have said it too harshly. He then got angry and started sulking. 

AITA ?

title: WIBTA for telling a patron at my pool I don't want to listen to her problems anymore?
body:
I have been working as a lifeguard during the summers. At first because it was easy but now because the money is really good if you put in lots of hours. I've worked the same single guard pool for 4 years and as the only guard scheduled for most of it.

There is a woman at the pool who isn't well mentally. She was pretty chill in the beginning of my time there but in the last two summers has declined. She stopped taking all of her physicatric meds and shifted to alternative forms of treatment, like dietary changes and essential oils. A Karen in the truest sense.

She is unemployed so she spends hours every day at the pool and just talks and talks about her problems and how she's been wronged. If she is to be believed she has had some awful things happen but most are totally self inflicted, but she blames everyone around her.

I had hoped she was evicted or moved out because no one had heard from or seen her for months. Day before the pool opens she texts me, I don't know how she got my number yet, and asks if I'm coming back.

I work 56hr/wk and am taking summer courses to contribute to my degree. I don't want or need her drama in my life but am bound to the pool. Would I be the asshole if I tell her the first time I see her that I don't want to hear her life story or problems, that I'm paid to care for the pool/patrons  and not to listen?

Edit: I forgot to mention that when she was chill talking was a welcome pastime at the pool. They were conversations rather than monologues with breaks where she expects me to agree with her.

title: WIBTA if I tried to get an Ubereats driver fired?
body:
I don't know if they can even get fired; AITA for trying? 

I ordered Ubereats tonight. Right after I had placed the order, I realized the delivery address was set to go to my work, not my house. I called customer service and gave them the correct address. This is before my order was even finished. They called the delivery person to see if she would be willing to bring the order to my house instead of my work. She said no, that she wasn't going to do that, and that she'd deliver the food to my (empty, closed) office instead. 

Ubereats will compensate the driver for the change. For context, my house is 8 minutes away from the restaurant. My work is 7 minutes away from the restaurant. 

I called the restaurant, and they said they couldn't cancel my order, but they wrote the correct address on the bag and asked the driver to bring it to the right place. I finally got the driver to answer the phone. She said that Ubereats had never called her, and that she would bring the food to my house. Cool. 

But then I got a text message that the driver was trying to contact me, I didn't answer the phone, and my order would be cancelled without refund. 

I called Ubereats and was able to get a refund, but I'm honestly so upset that this woman lied and took my food. I understand if she didn't want to bring it to my house--I could go pick it up at work. But she said she would bring it to my house, and then lied and said I didn't answer the phone when I did. And she got a free meal out of it. 

WIBTA if I sent another message to Ubereats? I have her name, car type, and a few digits of her license plate.

title: AITA for how I responded to being shushed?
body:
This happened last night and I’m still kind of perplexed as to how this became such a big deal. It all seems so silly but I’m seriously on the verge of breaking up with my boyfriend of 5 months, “Carl”, over a stupid shush. 

So it all started when I was over at Carl’s apartment with about five of his friends. We just finished watching the spiderverse movie. The credits started rolling and I said something like “that was actually pretty good.” (I was a little skeptical of the idea of enjoying a superhero movie because i normally don’t like them). 

At that point, “Hank”, who is one of Carl’s friends, who in all honesty, I never cared for, shushed me. Like he literally shushed me and then said, “You’re gonna miss the post credit scene.” Keep in mind, that it was just credits at this point and I only said a single sentence. 

I think a grown adult shushing another grown adult is condescending and beyond rude. If he asked me to "please be quiet, there's a post credit scene", I would maybe have internally rolled my eyes but I definitely wouldn't have said anything. So I said with a pretty disgusted tone, “Did you seriously just shush me?” A couple of the guys laughed and did the “ooooooh she got you” thing. Hank’s face got red and he didn’t respond but was kind of cold to me when he left (after the incredibly important post credit scene).

I honestly didn’t think much of it but after everyone left, my boyfriend said that I shouldn’t have said anything and that if I had a problem, I should have come directly to him in private after the movie and that he would have told Hank. I told him this was ridiculous. This isn’t middle school. If I have a problem with the way someone’s acting, I can tell them myself and I don't need him to step in for me. He said I didn’t really care about the shushing, that I only wanted to embarrass Hank because I didn’t like him and told me that he doesn’t know if he wants to be with someone like that. That really set me off and we yelled at each other until I finally got the sense to leave and tell him that we’d talk later. 

We haven’t been in touch at all today. My friends think I did nothing wrong and that we should just break up but i would like some objective opinion as to if I’m the asshole here. Thanks in advance

title: WIBTA if I talked to a manager about my asshole coworker?
body:
I get how this sounds like a validation post, but I'm genuinely not sure what to do.

I got hired at this large DIY store early this summer and have been working a lot of hours there. I really, really enjoy the job. I'm 18 and most of the employees are adults, but there are a few minors. The coworker in question is a retirement age woman (she works for some extra cash) who seems to really dislike people under the age of 25. She's really condescending to me and the minors and it feels like she goes out of her way to point out what we're doing wrong. She brings up really obscure safety procedures so she can correct us. (things like you can't put a work phone in your pocket that no one follows)

I don't have an issue with correction. When my supervisors tell me to do something differently I'm understanding and make changes.

I'm thinking about reporting her because she's rude to me and other younger workers, but the issue is that all the things she corrects me on are technically "right." What would I say to a manager "I'm mad at my coworker because she's telling me company policy?"

title: AITA for getting my coworker fired for sexual harassment?
body:
This happened about a year ago. I keep hearing that whoever got my former coworker fired is such an asshole. Only out for themselves. Most people don’t know what happened. The executives have been pretty tight-lipped, thankfully.

For about three years, this coworker would make comments or whistle if he was walking behind me. He would press himself up against me if I was climbing a latter. He said he was trying to make me feel safe, more comfortable because I am really afraid of heights. His reasoning wasn’t believable because of the comments and noises he would make. He also tricked me into looking at a dick pic. Once on a trip to another location, he pulled off on a dirt road, “accidentally” touched my boob and commented about how nice it felt, then told me we could get paid to fuck. When I said no, he got out and took a leak. I was terrified.

He told me about the various employees at other locations that he slept with and other things they did. He made comments about all different women all the time. I’m pretty sure he’s a sex addict.

The thing is, I’m terrified of confrontation. I was also afraid the executives would choose to believe him o er me. So I only clearly told him to stop after years of this. And I only told my boss after making a comment about him and getting prodded for what I was talking about. He was gone in less than 24 hours and wasn’t told he was fired due to sexual harassment. He was informed his behavior didn’t line up with company values.

So am I the asshole for not being clear about saying no because I was afraid and then getting him fired for it?

title: WIBTA - if I don’t send my friend money?
body:
Hello, welcome to petty town 

I hung out with a friend of mine 2 weeks (or so) back and she said “if you pay, I’ll send you the money when we get back”

So I paid. It was like 150kr (around 30$) in total, which we would split. So 15$ for her. She never paid when we got back. We hung out for another 5 hours before she left. I texted her immediately.

“Hey if you send 5$ for the ice coffee, I’ll just pay the rest.”

She replies: “oh wow it’s raining!” And then went on about ... the weather. I didn’t ask for the money again because I felt bad asking for such a small amount. But she said she would transfer. It felt kinda sketchy. 

Today she bought some stuff for a party we are throwing and I owe her 2$. I really have been thinking about saying “oh now you only owe 13$ from the last time” 

Would that make me a total asshole or is it justified? 

(I said she could just send 5$ but when she didn’t I changed my mind and she owes me 15$ instead)

It’s not about the money it’s about the fact that she didn’t ask me or anyone if they were ok with this.  And I just don’t want to, but I feel like I’m going to be forced to because she didn’t even ask and everyone seems ok with it. 

So wibta?

TL;DR don’t want to pitch in even though all my coworkers are ok with pitching in for a present, was never asked if I wanted to.

title: wibta if i confronted my bf’s secret furry fetish?
body:
For some background, years ago in middle school I dated a guy who was a furry and he tried so hard to get me into it and it wasn’t for me and he ended up creeping me out extensively because of some things he did. To this day, furries make me uncomfortable. I don’t have a problem with them, whatever you like is your business and I’m not one to judge, but everyone close to me knows it just bothers me and brings me back to those dark middle school days. (dramatic i know) I’d noticed a few things at first that got my radar going. The furry account searches on his instagram. I thought nothing of it at first, maybe he had a friend who was a furry, even I have one. But then i noticed some sexual pictures on his camera roll that really made me wonder what was going on. But I didn’t wanna think anything of it because we are very open about our sexual interests together so I thought he’d tell me about it if it was a thing. 

A month ago at a friend of ours party, I was talking to a friend of mine who used to date my boyfriend. She was asking how we were doing and the conversation was going fine until she said “I’ve always had the suspicion that he was maybe a furry.” I asked her what she meant and she said some of the stuff she saw him look at, but he never talked about it. 

I decided a few days after that party to ask him if he was interested in the furry fetish. I asked very calmly, I didn’t wanna seem like I was accusing him or being judge mental and he said he’d looked into it before and he wasn’t interested. I accepted that answer until a few days ago when he was showing me a picture on his phone and I noticed some rather explicit images of pokémon while he was scrolling (and scrolling fast might i add). 

I had to know, so i looked through his phone. He had a whole folder in his pictures of furry porn, he had been looking at accounts on instagram and ifunny. I’m not proud of doing that, but it was killing me because no matter how many times I brought it up, he denied any interest. 

I want to confront him about it. I’m not mad or anything, I’m just hurt he’d keep that from me. I may have had a bad experience with a furry but I love my boyfriend and if that’s something he’s into, id try to find a way to where I could be comfortable with it or at least try for him. 

I don’t want to upset him but I want to know what’s going on. So, wibta?

EDIT: For some clarification due to comments i’ve read, i’ve been with my boyfriend for 2 1/2 years. We are also VERY open sexually. I know what kind of porn he watches, we’ve talked about it. And a furry fetish would definitely not be his “weirdest” one. We do have an open phone policy but only with probable cause and I will admit it was dick move to go through his phone without the best reason. Also, a furry didn’t just creep me out in middle school, he said and did some very disgusting things to me that bother me to this day. I don’t want to get into too much detail about that. I did not go through his phone joust to find something to be angry about, I wanted to find some answers because I’m genuinely bewildered as to why this one thing is something he can’t tell. No my bf being a furry or liking it isn’t a dealbreaker for me, it’s about the fact that he didn’t tell me. He does know what happened to me with this incident in middle school, but I am not a judge-mental person so I’ve never said anything about hating furries or thinking they’re disgusting. We have both had some fetishes/fantasies that the other didn’t think they liked or were just hesitant to try, but we’ve talked about them and explored them together to find what works for us a couple. Also, we are both 22.

EDIT 2: I did not go through my boyfriends phone to dig up dirt or catch him doing something wrong, nor did I even think I would find something like that. I just wanted to know the truth. My partner and I have never had any secrets between us sexually because of some past issues in other relationships, so to feel like he was hiding something from me was worrying me. If he’s a furry, i will love him regardless. I just wanted the truth. What i saw on his phone doesn’t really confirm or deny anything. Maybe he just looks at it, maybe he wants to be a furry, maybe it just interests him, i don’t know. I probably won’t confront him. Not sure

title: WIBTA if I asked out a girl I work with?
body:
There’s a girl I work with. I don’t really know her, but she’s always very friendly and she always seems to be kind and in a good mood. She’s cute, she remembers my name, and overall she just seems like a really great gal. I don’t know a ton about her, but at break she commented on my R A Salvator book and said that she’s always loved The Icewind Dale trilogy the best, so it seems like we might have some things in common and I’d love to get to know her better.

The problem is that I know that she’s been asked out by a few people at work, and that she’s told all of them that she doesn’t want to date anyone she works with. I’m tempted to think that this is a lie because she wants to let them down easy, but if it’s the truth I don’t want to put her in a bad spot. WIBTA if I asked her out even though I know she gave that as a reason for rejection for multiple guys?
